    • Method Detail

      • s

        public static String s(@Nullable
       Object o)
        Return the String representation of the given object, or the string "null" if it is null. Helpful for avoiding NullPointerExceptions.

      • htmlEncode

        public static String htmlEncode(String val)
        Deprecated. use StringEscapeUtils.
        Converts a string into an html encoded string.
        Parameters:
        val - The string to be encoded.
        Returns:
        The given string with any special characters replaced with the appropriate HTML codes.

      • cap

        @NotNull
public static String cap(@NotNull
                 String s)
        Capitalize the given string.
        Returns:
        The given string with the first letter capitalized.

      • oracleEscapeSingleQuotes

        @Nullable
public static String oracleEscapeSingleQuotes(@Nullable
                                       String s)
        Replace any single quotes with doubled single quotes, so "foo 'bar' foo" becomes "foo ''bar'' foo".

      • tokenSet

        @NotNull
public static Set<String> tokenSet(String s,
                           String delim)
        Deprecated. use org.apache.commons.lang.StringUtils.split()
        Tokenize a string.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to be tokenized.
        delim - The delimiters to use (see StringTokenizer for details)
        Returns:
        A Set of tokens.

      • join

        public static String join(@NotNull
          Iterable s,
          String delim)
        Join a Collection of Strings together into one string, separating the tokens with a delimiter. The delimiting string will be placed only between tokens, and will not be added before the first or after the last token.
        Parameters:
        s - The Set of Strings to be joined.
        delim - A string to insert between tokens.
        Returns:
        The joined string. // * @deprecated use org.apache.commons.lang.StringUtils.join()

      • joinSorted

        public static String joinSorted(Set s,
                String delim)

          String delim)

        public static String join(double[] doubles,
          String delim)

      • month2name

        @NotNull
public static String month2name(int i)
        Return the name of the month associated with the given int. I think these are 0-based, but it's easiest just to use Calendar.JANUARY and so on to avoid any confusion.

      • escapeHTML

        public static String escapeHTML(String s)
        Deprecated. use StringEscapeUtils.
        Converts a string into an html encoded string.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to be encoded.
        Returns:
        The given string with any special characters replaced with the appropriate HTML codes.
